value.title: Write Conditional Statement Using SWITCH in DAX and Power BI
value.excerpt: Conditional expressions are one of the most commonly used expressions in any language as well as DAX. However, in DAX, if you have multiple IF THEN expressions, there is an easier way of doing it; using a function called SWITCH, this video is about how you can use switch function in DAX and Power BI
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/fOErC7eaWZ0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Apply AND Logic to Multiple Selection in DAX Slicer
value.excerpt: When you apply a multiple selection to a slicer or to a filter, you obtain a logical OR condition between selected items. This video shows how to implement a logical AND condition in a measure instead of the standard OR one. Article and download: https://sql.bi/26121?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/tONOosN1xAs" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: CALCULATE in DAX #05: Remove table filters
value.excerpt: Don't remove filters from tables when you want to remove column filters. Learn the difference and fix your DAX formulas! How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/?aff=yt CALCULATE function:

value.title: Choosing between Date or Integer to represent dates in Power BI and Tabular
value.excerpt: This video provides you with the technical knowledge to choose between using a Date or an Integer to create the relationship between your fact table and the Date dimension. Article and download: https://sql.bi/717512?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive

value.title: Computing totals by summing visible values in DAX
value.excerpt: This video shows how to compute a measure that sums the values produced row by row in the visual into the visual total, instead of recomputing the total value in the filter context of the total. Article and download: https://sql.bi/89870
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/YtIdcCYnZ9w" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Create Static Tables in DAX Using the DATATABLE Function
value.excerpt: The DATATABLE function can create static tables in a Power BI model specifying column names and data types. Article and download: https://sql.bi/27271/?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/?aff=yt

value.title: Creating a calculated table with DAX Studio
value.excerpt: Use DAX Studio to write and test the expression for a calculated table in Power BI. How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ DAX Studio: https://daxstudio.org/

value.title: Customize default values for each user in Power BI reports
value.excerpt: Learn how to use calculation groups to define a default set of values for columns in your model. Different users can have different default values, and yet retain the full capability to select different values. Article and download: https://sql.bi/717242?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/ZHlC55APxPs" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Evaluation of variables in DAX
value.excerpt: Variables in DAX are constants, and this could be very confusing! Watch this video to understand how the evaluation of variables works in DAX. How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/

value.excerpt: Understanding the differences between the formula engine and the storage engine is the first step to understand the performance metrics and optimize a DAX formula. value.title: Highlighting the minimum and maximum values in a Power BI matrix
value.excerpt: This video shows how to use DAX and conditional formatting together to highlight the minimum and maximum values in a matrix in Power BI. Article and download: https://sql.bi/662096?aff=yt

value.title: How to return 0 instead of BLANK in DAX
value.excerpt: How to force a measure to return zero instead of blank, in order to highlight combinations of attributes with no data.  Article and download: https://sql.bi/713576?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/?aff=yt

value.title: Introducing LOOKUPVALUE
value.excerpt: This video shows how to use LOOKUPVALUE, which is a handy function for any developer to have in their toolbelt. Article and download: https://sql.bi/670595?aff=yt Additional resources: Expanded tables (article): https://sql.bi/65647?aff=yt

value.title: Naming temporary columns in DAX
value.excerpt: Discuss a naming convention for temporary columns in DAX expressions to avoid ambiguity with the measure reference notation. Article and download: https://sql.bi/377817?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/?aff=yt

value.title: Optimizing duplicated DAX expressions using variables
value.excerpt: This video describes how to use variables to optimize the performance of DAX expressions containing multiple instances of the same measure or the same sub-expression. There are two related articles and downloads: https://sql.bi/62887/?aff=yt (Optimizing duplicated DAX expressions using variables) https://sql.bi/67786/?aff=yt

value.title: Set functions in DAX UNION, INTERSECT, and EXCEPT
value.excerpt: Discover the DAX functions that manipulate sets; they are useful to create queries and sometimes also to author measures. Article and download: https://sql.bi/674755?aff=yt

value.title: Sorting months in fiscal calendars in DAX
value.excerpt: This video shows a basic technique used to sort months according to a fiscal calendar, by using a couple of calculated columns and the “sort by column” feature of Power BI. Article and download: https://sql.bi/492713?aff=yt

value.title: Understanding data lineage in DAX
value.excerpt: What is data lineage in DAX? How does it work? How can you write better DAX code knowing it? value.title: Understanding the difference between LASTDATE and MAX in DAX
value.excerpt: This video explains why in many cases, MAX should be used instead of LASTDATE to search for the last date in a time period using DAX. Article and download: https://sql.bi/673766?aff=yt

value.title: Using CONCATENATEX in DAX
value.excerpt: This video showcases the use of CONCATENATEX, a handy DAX function to return a list of values in a measure. Article and download: https://sql.bi/206871

value.title: Working below a DAX formula’s granularity

value.title: 5 Productivity Benefits of Tabular Editor 3

The 3rd edition of Tabular Editor has just been released, and it is a major upgrade from version 2. TE 3 is not [...]Read More »

value.title: Build a P&L in Power BI Without Any DAX
value.excerpt: This is the third article where I have covered building a P&L in Power BI. My first 2 articles here and here focused on how to use the DAX language to solve some of the common problems with P&L reporting, such as adding sub totals into the visual, % of [...]Read More »

value.title: Building a Matrix with Asymmetrical Columns and Rows in Power BI
value.excerpt: I have written a few articles that are related to this topic (articles that utilise this same technique to solve a problem), but never before have I explained the stand alone concept of how to build a visual with asymmetrical columns and rows in Power BI.  Let me explain with [...]Read More »

value.title: Building a P&L in Power BI – Part 2 (Percentages)
